Package myTest

Class IteratorTest

java.lang.Object
myTest.IteratorTest
public class IteratorTest extends Object
Summary: This test suite provides tests for the StackAdapter.StackIterator class methods

Test Suite Design: The design of this thest suite is all about testing each method of the Vector class. The reason is to isolate every type of operation in order to validate each functionality.

Pre-condition: J2RE 1.4.2 and JUnit 4.13.1 installed and added to the path. A new empty object of type StackAdapter must always be instantiated before each test. All execution variables are never in an uninitialized state (i.e. stack = null) unless explicitly desired. Methods that take as parameters classes that implement HCollection are passed suitable objects for this interface, therefore they do not throw the exception ClassCastException. All the elements contained in the stack are known a priori in order to allow the verification after the invocation of the tested methods

Post-Condition: the methods implemented must always modify the stacks so that the elements contained are exactly those expected starting from their manual insertion and have to provide a positive outcome.

Test Cases: testHasNext(), testAdd(), testHasPrevious(), testNext(), testNextIndex(), testPrevious(), testPreviousIndex(), testRemove(), testSet().

Test Suite Execution Records: Records are exaclty what this test suite provides as result of TestRunner class.

Execution Variables: StackAdapter stack (supports optional operations), iter (the iterator).

See Also:
  • HIterator
  • HListIterator

  • Method Details

    • setup

      public void setup()
      setup before each test.

    • clean

      public void clean()
      cleanup after each test

    • testHasNext

      public void testHasNext()
      Summary: Tests the StackAdapter.StackIterator.hasNext() method

      Test Case Design: The test provides informations about the presence of another element in the next position of the iterator index.

      Test Description: Two elements are added in the stack and the iterator through the method check if it has more elements in the stack.

      Pre-condition: stack is initialize as Empty and has to initialize its own iterator.

      Post-Condition: Iterator should find itself in the last position of the stack.

      Expected Results: IteratorAdapter.hasNext() == true until last element included;

    • testNext

      public void testNext()
      Summary: Tests the StackAdapter.StackIterator.next() method

      Test Case Design: The test should return each element in the iterator position and an Exception if there are no elements at the end.

      Test Description: Some elements are added in the stack. Then the next() method is call in a for loop until last element. Each loop is returning the object in the iterator position. At the end the next() method is called again in order to throw NoSuchElementException.

      Pre-condition: stack is initialize as Empty and has to initialize its own iterator.

      Post-Condition: Iterator should find itself in the last position of the stack.

      Expected Results: next() == stack.get(index) each loop;

    • testRemove

      public void testRemove()
      Summary: Tests the StackAdapter.StackIterator.remove()

      Test Case Design: This test provides informations about all the possible iterator state that throw IllegalStateException. Then it tries to remove elements in the stack.

      Test Description: In the first place we look for exceptions to be thrown then if the states are correct the remove method is called after 5 elements have been added to the stack;

      Pre-condition: stack is initialize as Empty and has to initialize its own iterator.

      Post-Condition: Only three elements should be present in the stack.

      Expected Results: Elements in the stack: 2,4,5.

    • testAdd

      public void testAdd()
      Summary: Tests the StackAdapter.StackIterator.add(Object)

      Test Case Design: This test tries to add elements in the stack if that is a supported operation.

      Test Description: In the first place we look for exceptions to be thrown then the add method is called;

      Pre-condition: stack is initialize as Empty and has to initialize its own iterator.

      Post-Condition: Three elements should be present in the stack.

      Expected Results: Elements in the stack: 2,4,5.

    • testHasPrevious

      public void testHasPrevious()
      Summary: Tests the StackAdapter.StackIterator.hasPrevious() method

      Test Case Design: The test provides informations about the presence of another element in the previous position of the iterator index.

      Test Description: Two elements are added in the stack and the iterator through the method check if it has more elements before him in the stack.

      Pre-condition: stack is initialize as Empty and has to initialize its own iterator.

      Post-Condition: Iterator should find itself in the first position of the stack.

      Expected Results: IteratorAdapter.hasprevious() == true until first element included;

    • testNextIndex

      public void testNextIndex()
      Summary: Tests the StackAdapter.StackIterator.nextIndex() method

      Test Case Design: This test provides information about nextIndex() calls. No exceptions are thrown.

      Test Description: Two elements are added to the stack and the nextIndex() method is called.

      Pre-condition: stack is initialize as Empty and has to initialize its own iterator.

      Post-Condition: Two elements are correctly added to the stack and the iterator should return correct indexes.

      Expected Results: nextIndex() == 0, nextIndex() == 1;

    • testPrevious

      public void testPrevious()
      Summary: Tests the StackAdapter.StackIterator.previous() method

      Test Case Design: The test should return each element in the iterator position and an Exception if there are no elements before index 0.

      Test Description: Some elements are added in the stack. Then the previous() method is call in a for loop until first element. Each loop is returning the object in the iterator position. At the end the previous() method is called again in order to throw NoSuchElementException.

      Pre-condition: stack is initialize as Empty and has to initialize its own iterator.

      Post-Condition: Iterator should find itself in the first position of the stack.

      Expected Results: previous() == stack.get(index) each loop;

    • testPreviousIndex

      public void testPreviousIndex()
      Summary: Tests the StackAdapter.StackIterator.previousIndex() method

      Test Case Design: This test provides information about previousIndex() calls. No exceptions are thrown.

      Test Description: Two elements are added to the stack and the previousIndex() method is called.

      Pre-condition: stack is initialize as Empty and has to initialize its own iterator.

      Post-Condition: Two elements are correctly added to the stack and the iterator should return correct indexes.

      Expected Results: previousIndex() == 1, previousIndex() == 0;

    • testSet

      public void testSet()
      Summary: Tests the StackAdapter.StackIterator.set(Object)

      Test Case Design: This test tries to set elements in the stack if that is a supported operation.

      Test Description: In the first place we look for exceptions to be thrown then the set method is called;

      Pre-condition: stack is initialize as Empty and has to initialize its own iterator.

      Post-Condition: Three elements should be present in the stack.

      Expected Results: Elements in the stack: 2,4,5.
